definition: to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: If you thinking of water, well, water doesn't really shrink or expand.
sentences.chinese: 如果是水的話，它不會膨脹或者凝縮。

sentences.english: Finally, on the basis of testing, the mathematical model is established.
sentences.chinese: 最後，在試驗的基礎上，建立了凝縮的數學模型。

sentences.english: Eventually , the water stored as vapor in the atmosphere will condense to liquid again.
sentences.chinese: 最後，大氣中儲存的水蒸氣將再次凝縮爲液體。

sentences.english: Methylation of chromatin causes it to condense.
sentences.chinese: 染色質甲基化後會出現凝縮。

sentences.english: No glittering, compact drops of dawn?
sentences.chinese: 沒有閃光的，凝縮的，黎明的露滴？

sentences.english: Discourse condensation is a popular pragmatic phenomenon in Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 話語凝縮是一種非常普遍的漢語語用現象。

sentences.english: This paper presents the effect of the appropriate polyvinyl alcohol fibers on the settlement shrinkage performance of concrete.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了聚乙烯醇纖維對混凝土凝縮性能的影響。

sentences.english: A cloud is a condensation of water vapour .
sentences.chinese: 雲是由水蒸汽凝縮而成的。
